title: Email Channel
description: Email messages, delivered via SMTP to list subscribers channel.

@id.description: The ID uniquely identifies the channel. Each specific experience channel defines a constant `@id`.

xdm:mode.description: How experiences are delivered in this channel.

meta:enum.push: The publisher of an experience can initiate an experience by sending a message into the channel. Most `push` channels involve some form of subscription or opt-in.
meta:enum.pull: The consumer can initiate an experience by requesting a location in the channel. Most `pull` channels give publishers some control how the experience is then delivered.
meta:enum.bidirectional: Both `push` and `pull` interaction modes are supported by the channel.

@type.description: The `@type` property is used to provide a rough classification of channels with similar properties.

meta:enum.https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/channel-types/w: The world wide web, including mobile web

xdm:contentTypes.description: The content types that this channel can deliver.

xdm:metricTypes.description: The metrics that can be collected in this channel.

xdm:locationTypes.description: The types of locations (virtual places) that this channel consists of and can deliver content to.
